results.title: Body defences against disease
results.brief_description: This film is an exposition of the human body’s three lines of defence against disease: the skin, the phagocytic cells and lymphatics, and the blood. Types of antibodies and their effect, the action of the liver and the spleen, and the application of a defence mechanism in specific cases are studied in detail. Immunology is also studies, and microphotography shows us phagocytosis.

results.title: Body care and grooming
results.brief_description: Made in 1947 to promote good grooming techniques for males and females. Shows boys and girls of senior high school taking care of their skin, hair, nails and teeth thus demonstrating habits which should form part of every ‘civilised’ person’s daily routine. Although the film has dated, it captures the styles and attitudes of the time.

results.title: Bob Graham
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Looks at the work of Bob Graham, an Australian author-illustrator. This successful illustrator has a clean, simple style which belies the depth and imagery of his work.

results.title: Boating and good sense
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the proper method of equipping, starting, and handling power boat. Discusses safe practices for the water skier and the person handling the boat. No other credits available.

results.title: Boat people
results.brief_description:
Artist-activist group Boat-people.org organised large scale projection of their logo image - an Endeavour style Tall Ship above the words “boat people” on the side of the Sydney Opera House in October 2001. This is rough video footage of the projection and a security guard asking them to leave. There is an interview with organiser Deborah Kelly. This is a preview tape only, documentation of an event.

Second part of tape shows street protest, dance, parade, details unclear.

results.title: Board and care
results.creator_credit: Ron Ellis, Sarah Pillsbury and National Endowment for the Arts
results.brief_description: Deals with a Down’s Syndrome girl and boy who reveal the deep human need for communication and sharing. Ricky and Lila meet for a brief afternoon of innocent closeness, eating together and talking about what they see. When Lila is sent away to school, Ricky vainly searches the town for her. Featuring Richard Cross as Ricky and Laura Jean Ellis as Lila. (Academy Award Winner in 1980) Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Ellis, Sarah Pillsbury and National Endowment for the Arts

results.title: Blueprint for the future: Melbourne 1985
results.brief_description: Describes the Master Plan intended to cope with Melbourne’s traffic situation in 1985. Intense survey work has been carried out, the information analysed in computers and the appropriate plans made, mainly in the form of overpasses and freeways. Stresses the need for a revitalised public transport system as well as roads. Underground railways and streamlined trains and buses are needed. Includes plans for St Kilda Junction, Westgate Bridge and the Melbourne Loop system. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Blueprint for survival
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Shows the development of moth, beetle, lacewing and fly larvae, through periodic shedding of the rigid outer coating. Stages in nymphal development of the grasshopper, praying mantis, phasmid and sucking bug, final moult of a cicada and tree cricket and emergence of a butterfly are shown. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
